Pre-Game Insights: Wales continue life without Gareth Bale, who retired from international football.
The Turks, on the other hand, did well to make it to the EURO 2024 quarter-finals, meaning that they are high on confidence ahead of the trip to Cardiff.
A man to watch in the away team will be Real Madrid rising star Arda Gular, who enjoyed a very successful EURO 2024 campaign.
As under 2.5 goals have been netted in each of the previous three meetings between the two sides, a low-scoring affair is on the cards at Cardiff City Stadium.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The attacking midfielder with great vision and very good goalscoring record started his professional career at Karlsruher, scoring impressive 17 goals in 50 league outings to earn a move to Bundesliga side Hamburg.
The midfield maestro had a bright start to his career in the Turkey national team, scoring 5 goals in first 16 caps, and chances are he will become a leader for Milli Takim in the foreseeable future.
Despite being part of the United Kingdom, Wales national football team has been competing in FIFA tournaments since 1950, although they have so far only reached two tournament finals.
Others: New boss Craig Bellamy has included the likes of Ollie Cooper and Mark Harris to the squad as well as Leeds United goalkeeper Karl Darlow.
